data.title: Courant 8 - CODART
data.text: codart Courant 8/June 2004 codartCourant Published by Stichting codart P.O. Box 76709 nl-1070 ka Amsterdam The Netherlands www.codart.nl Managing editor: Rachel Esner e resner@xs4all.nl Editors: Wietske Donkersloot, Gary Schwartz t +31 (0)20 305 4515 f +31 (0)20 305 4500 e wietske@codart.nl codart board Henk van der Walle, chairman Wim Jacobs, controller of the Instituut Collectie Nederland, secretarytreasurer Rudi Ekkart, director of the Rijksbureau voor Kunsthistorische Documentatie Jan Houwert, chairman of the Board of Management of the Koninklijke Wegener N.V. Paul Huvenne, director of the Koninklijk Museum voor Schone Kunsten, Antwerp Jeltje van Nieuwenhoven, member of the Labor Party faction in the Dutch parliament codartis an international council for curators of Dutch and Flemish art. It supports inter-museum cooperation in the study and display of art from the Lowlands through a variety of means, including congresses, study trips, publications and a website (www.codart.nl). The organization was founded and is aided by the Netherlands Institute for Cultural Heritage. It enjoys the generous support of the Netherlands Ministry of Education, Culture and Science and the Ministry of Welfare, Health and Culture of the Flemish Community. codartCourant appears twice a year. Contributions are welcome. codartCourant is designed by Typography Interiority & Other Serious Matters, The Hague issn1388 9559 contents 2 A word from the director 3 News and notes from around the world 3 Czech Republic, Prague, National Gallery: A birthday greeting to Hana Seifertová 4 France, Paris, Fondation Custodia 4 Hungary, Budapest Museum of Fine Arts 6 Russia, St. Petersburg, State Hermitage Museum 7 codart zeven: Dutch and Flemish art in Poland 8 Congress, Utrecht, 7-9 March 2004 13 Antoni Ziemba, The Low Countries and Poland: a history of artistic connections 16 Hanna Benesz, Early Netherlandish, Dutch and Flemish paintings in Polish collections 19 Joanna Tomicka, Dutch and Flemish prints in major Polish collections 23 Maciej Monkiewicz, Rubens and Rembrandt, their predecessors and successors: 16th- to 18th-century Flemish and Dutch drawings in Polish collections 26 Krystyna Gutowska-Dudek, The Dutch and Flemish paintings from the collection of Jan iiiSobieski housed in Wilanow Palace Museum 30 Wanda M. Rudzin´ ska, The Tilman van Gameren archive in the print room of Warsaw University Library 33 Study trip to Gdan´ sk, Warsaw and Kraków, 18-25 April 2004 39 Rulers of Poland, 14th-18th century 39 Index of Polish individuals and families 40 Website news 41 Appointments 41 codartmembership news 42 Museum list 48 codartdates Preview of upcoming exhibitions and other events, June-December 2004 Poster for the exhibition of prints and drawings organized by the Czartoryski Museum in honor of the codart zevenvisit to Kraków: Treasures of the Netherlands.
